articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Congratulatory Message from Mongolian President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Congratulatory Message from Mongolian President
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a congratulatory message from Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj, Mongolian president, on April 22.
					 The message extended to Kim Jong Un and the people of the DPRK sincere congratulations as regards his reelection as first chairman of the NDC of the DPRK at the 1st Session of the 13th Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.
					
					 The president in the message said he was satisfied with the fact that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between Mongolia and the DPRK are growing stronger in conformity with the interests of the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 The president said he was pleased that he can steadily cooperate with Kim Jong Un to expand and develop the relations and cooperation between the two countries and ensure peace and security in the Northeast Asian region in the future, too.
					
					 The president wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the friendly people of the DPRK prosperity.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Myanmar President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Myanmar President
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a congratulatory message from Thein Sein, president of the Republic of the Union of Myanmar, on April 22.
					 The Myanmar president in his message extended warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of the people of Myanmar and on his own behalf on his reelection as the first chairman of the NDC of the DPRK according to the unanimous will and desire of all service personnel and people of the DPRK.
					
					 He expressed belief that the DPRK would steadily develop and its people achieve eternal prosperity under the seasoned leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Myanmar president sincerely wished Kim Jong Un happiness and success and the people of the DPRK steady progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Angolan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Angolan President
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Jose Eduardo Dos Santos, president of Angola, on April 15. 
					 The Angolan president congratulated Kim Jong Un on his reelection as first chairman of the NDC of the DPRK on behalf of the Angolan government and on his own behalf, wishing him success in the noble work. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un's reelection is the expression of the Korean people's trust in him who is leading the drive to defend peace and national unity and achieve the socio-economic development, the president said. 
					
					 He expressed the belief that Kim Jong Un will wisely lead the work for stability and reconciliation on the Korean peninsula in conformity with the desire of the Korean people. 
					
					 He reaffirmed the will of the Angolan government to continuously strengthen the ties of friendship and cooperation between the two countries, paying highest tribute to Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Algerian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Algerian President
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a congratulatory message from Abdelaziz Bouteflika, president of the People's Democratic Republic of Algeria, on April 16.
					 The president in the message extended sincere congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of the people and government of Algeria and on his own behalf on Kim Jong Un's reelection as first chairman of the NDC of the DPRK. The message wished him great success in his noble work.
					
					 Availing himself of the opportunity, the president reaffirmed that he will make efforts together with Kim Jong Un to strengthen the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries in conformity with the interests of the two peoples.

articles.title: Koreans in Japan Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Koreans in Japan Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- A home-visiting group of Koreans in Japan led by An Thae Du visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Friday.
					 Members of the group laid a bouquet before the statues of the peerlessly great men who made contributions to strengthening and developing the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and paid tribute to them.
					
					 The group arrived here on the same day.

articles.title: WPK Delegation Returns Home from Bangladesh
articles.content:
WPK Delegation Returns Home from Bangladesh
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by Ri Chang Gun, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Party, came back home on Friday after taking part in the 9th Congress of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work on Trade Unions Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work on Trade Unions Observed
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- There took place here on Friday a meeting to mark the 30th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's work "On Further Improving the Work of the Trade Unions."
					 The work, published on May 3, Juche 73 (1984), fully clarifies all theoretical and practical issues arising in the building and activities of the trade unions in the era of Juche including the nature, mission, objectives and tasks of the unions and the principles governing the activities of the unions.
					
					 The meeting was attended by officials of the trade unions and officials concerned and others.
					
					 Hyon Sang Ju, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, in his report said that publication of the work enriched the Juche-based idea and theory on the building of the federation and provided a landmark, a radical turning point to develop the work of the federation as required by the higher stage of the Korean revolution.
					
					 Thanks to the leadership and loving care of Kim Jong Il, the federation developed into an organization for ideological education boundlessly loyal to the leadership of the party and the leader, he said.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's idea on the building of the federation and his feats are being carried forward by supreme leader Kim Jong Un, he said, adding:
					
					 Kim Jong Un clearly indicated the tasks to be carried out by the federation and the ways to do so, attaching great importance to the position and role of the federation.
					
					 He underlined the need to steadily deepen the education in the Juche idea, the Songun idea, as guided by the spirit of the 8th Conference of Ideological Workers of the Workers' Party of Korea,  and dynamically conduct ideological education such as the education in the party's policies and revolutionary traditions and thus prepare the union officials and members as Kimilsungists-Kimjongilists with ardent loyalty to the party and the leader, transparent revolutionary faith and high degree of class awareness.
					
					 He called on all the unionists to unite closer around Kim Jong Un under the uplifted banner of the great Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and make vigorous endeavors for the final victory in the building of a thriving socialist nation and the revolutionary cause of Juche.

articles.title: Art Performance Given to Mark May Day
articles.content:
Art Performance Given to Mark May Day
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The State Merited Chorus gave a performance at the April 25 House of Culture on Thursday, May Day.
					 It was watched by Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop, O Su Yong, Hyon Sang Ju, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea, Ryom Chol Song, general of the Korean People's Army, and working people in Pyongyang. 
					
					 The performance began with orchestral music and series of song "Song Dedicated to the Sun". 
					
					 The performers sang high praises of the undying feats Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il performed by putting forward the working popular masses as masters of their own destinies for the first time in history and building a socialist power of Juche on this land through their inexhaustible creative ingenuity and strength.
					
					 The audience was greatly excited to listen to male chorus "May, Month of Victory," which represented the patriotic devotion of the working people of the DPRK who made the history of the victory of socialism and recorded a heroic epic of building a thriving nation, always sharing destiny with the party, and other songs. 
					
					 The performers presented Male solo and chorus "Blessed My Life", female folk solo and male chorus "Song of Big Fish Haul ", male chorus "Rosy Is Our Future" and other numbers impressively reflecting the pride and honor of the Korean people enjoying all well-beings and a bright future of a thriving nation. 
					
					 Also put on the stage were male choruses "No One Can Match Marshal", "Song of the Korean People's Army", "Peace Is Guaranteed by Our Arms" and other numbers representing the indomitable faith and militant resolution of the revolutionary army to accomplish the Juche revolutionary cause started in Mt. Paektu under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The performance ended with the male chorus "The Revolutionary Armed Forces Uphold Leadership of Marshal Only". It reflected the ardent revolutionary enthusiasm of all the service personnel and people to firmly advance along the road of independence, Songun and socialism indicated by the Generalissimos. 
					
					 The performance was highly acclaimed by the audience.

articles.title: Ceremony of Completion of Remodeling of Songdowon Int'l Children's Camp Held
articles.content:
Ceremony of Completion of Remodeling of Songdowon Int'l Children's Camp Held
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The statues of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il were erected at the Songdowon International Children's Camp.
					 The statue of the President depicts him, his face beaming with a broad smile, who shows fatherly love for pupils of the DPRK and various countries of the world seated on a bench in a park of the camp on the seaside with sweet briers in full bloom and the statue of Kim Jong Il portraying the smiling leader taking children to his arms.  
					
					 The camp is comprehensively equipped with everything necessary for campers' living including a room dedicated to the education in Kim Jong Il's patriotism, the international friendship children's hall, outdoor playground, gymnasium, indoor swimming pool and water park and archery field, aquarium, aviary and show room for stuffed specimens of animals.
					
					 An unveiling ceremony of the statues of the Generalissimos and a ceremony of the completion of remodeling of the camp took place with splendor on Friday.
					
					 Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, attended the ceremony.
					
					 Present there were Hwang Pyong So, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Choe Ryong Hae, Han Kwang Sang, Ri Il Hwan, Choe Hwi, Ma Won Chun, Kim Yo Jong, Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, service personnel of units of the KPA,   officials of the Mansudae Art Studio and the Guidance Bureau for the Construction of Revolutionary Sites and other units, soldier-builders, employees of the camp, shock brigade members and schoolchildren in Kangwong Province that made contributions to the erection of the statues and the remodeling of the camp. 
					
					 The statues of the Generalissimos were unveiled at the camp.
					
					 Leading officials of the party, the army and the camp unveiled the statues of the Generalissimos. 
					
					 The moment the statues were unveiled, the statues shed brilliant rays.
					
					 A floral basket in the august name of Kim Jong Un was placed before the statues.
					
					 Also laid there were floral baskets in the joint name of the Central Committee of the WPK, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and the Cabinet of the DPRK and in the name of all members of the Korean Children's Union. 
					
					 Floral baskets were also placed before the statues in the name of the Central Committee of the youth league, the joint organization of the KCU of Kangwon Province, cities and counties, the camp and the party and power organs and the youth league organizations and universities and schools in the province.
					
					 All the participants paid tribute to the statues, looking back with deep emotion on the revolutionary careers of the Generalissimos.
					
					 Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, made a speech at the ceremony.

articles.title: Colorful Events Held at Remodeled Songdowon International Children's Camp
articles.content:
Colorful Events Held at Remodeled Songdowon International Children's Camp
Wonsan, May 2 (KCNA) -- There took place sports and cultural events at the Songdowon International Children's Camp on Friday to mark the completion of its remodeling.
					 A final match of the children's national football tournament was played at the camp's outdoor playground which well matches the scenic beauty of Songdowon on the east coast of Korea.
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un took the grandstand.
					
					 Among the spectators were Hwang Pyong So, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Choe Ryong Hae, Han Kwang Sang, Ri Il Hwan, Choe Hwi, Ma Won Chun, Kim Yo Jong, Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, officials and employees of the camp, shock brigade members, officials of the youth league, school children and officials in Kangwon Province.
					
					 The finals between the teams of South Phyongan Province and South Hamgyong Province was decided by penalty kicks as they drew 1:1.
					
					 In the match the South Hamgyong Provincial team trounced its rival 5:4.
					
					 Then followed an awarding ceremony.
					
					 Kim Jong Un warmly acknowledged the enthusiastic cheers of the players and spectators at the end of the match.
					
					 He shook hands with the players and coaches of the teams and referees one by one and encouraged them before having a photo session with them.
					
					 He called even those who helped ensure the successful match close to him and had a photo taken with them.
					
					 On the same day a congratulatory performance "We are the happiest in the world!" was given by the Moranbong Band at the International Friendship Children's Hall of the camp.
					
					 Kim Jong Un watched the performance.
					
					 Put on the stage of the performance which started with  female chorus "Children's Union March" were such colorful numbers as female trio "General and Children", female duet "Father is at Frontline" and female solo "Our Father".
					
					 The performers impressively represented through fascinating and rich sound of Korean-style light music the undying exploits President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed by making sure that palaces and camps were built for children in every scenic spot across the country and made the history of love for children all their lives, calling them kings of the country.
					
					 They sang high praises of the fact that the great history of love shown by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu, is being given steady continuity on this land thanks to Kim Jong Un whom the people hold in high esteem as the father of the great family of the country.
					
					 The performers presented light music and serial songs "Collection of children's film music" and "World of cartoon films" based on theme songs of children's films liked by schoolchildren of the DPRK to meet their minds. They revved up the festive atmosphere.
					
					 The performance was highly acclaimed by the audience.
					
					 The sports and cultural events reached their climax with fireworks display at the end of the art performance. 
					
					 At the end of the fireworks display Kim Jong Un warmly waved back to all the participants who again broke into cheers of "hurrah!"

articles.title: Spring Int'l Trade Fair to Be Held in DPRK
articles.content:
Spring Int'l Trade Fair to Be Held in DPRK
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The 17th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair is to take place at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House on May 12-15.
					 The fair, sponsored by the Korean International Exhibition Corporation, will be attended by more than 300 companies from 10-odd countries and regions and foreign embassies here.
					
					 Presented to it will be high-tech competitive products in electronic, machinery, metal, building-material, transport, light, food and consumer goods industries.
					
					 During the fair, there will be wide-ranging trade contacts and consultations among companies.
					
					 The fair will be helpful to developing the cooperation and exchange among countries and regions in the fields of trade, economy and science and technology.

articles.title: Dry Spell Persists in DPRK
articles.content:
Dry Spell Persists in DPRK
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Drought has continues in the DPRK for a long time with 23.5 mm rainfall from mid-February to April 30 across the country, 35 percent of the yearly average rainfall of 83 mm or the lowest one since 1982.
					 Light rain was witnessed in some parts of the country between April 26 and 28, with 4 mm in Pyongyang and South Phyongan Province and 7-13 mm in North and South Hwanghae provinces.
					
					 According to a weather forecast expert, the dry spell will linger on in most parts of the country, including the coastal and central inland areas, till early May.
					
					 The drought has inflicted damage on several thousand hectares of earlier crops like wheat, barley and potato across the country.
					
					 Now, a campaign for overcoming damage has been conducted throughout the country.

articles.title: Knowledge Sharing on SEZs in DPRK Held
articles.content:
Knowledge Sharing on SEZs in DPRK Held
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- There took place at Yanggakdo International Hotel on Friday knowledge sharing on SEZs in the DPRK hosted by the Korea Economic Development Association.
					 It was attended by Ri Chol Sok, vice-chairman of the association, and its other officials and experts and teachers and researchers at scientific and educational institutions and officials concerned.
					
					 Also present there were Kyung-Ae Park, professor at University of British Columbia, Canada, prestigious experts on special economic zones from China, India, Canada, Philippines and the U.S. and foreign diplomatic envoys and representatives of international bodies here and foreign embassy officials.
					
					 Ri Chol Sok and Kyung-Ae Park made speeches.
					
					 The speakers congratulated those participants on the successful holding of the event and mentioned the importance of the exchange of each other's experience and cooperation in developing special economic zones and managing and operating them.
					
					 They said that the event would help to broaden experts' vision and expand the development work and also contribute to promoting the international exchange and cooperation.
					
					 Then followed speeches.
					
					 Introduced at the event were the present situation in some economic development zones of the DPRK and their prospect and policies of preferential treatment and the master plan for Wonsan-Kumgangsan area.
					
					 The results of researches and opinions were exchanged and the BOT widely applied to investment and cooperation and the experience gained by various countries in doing so were discussed.
					
					 The event marked an occasion in contributing to turning economic development zones of the DPRK into world-level economic cooperation zones by introducing the advanced experience gained in special economic zones according to the specific conditions of the country.

articles.title: 29th National Scientific, Technological Festival Closes
articles.content:
29th National Scientific, Technological Festival Closes
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The 29th National Scientific and Technological Festival closed with due ceremony at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House on Friday.
					 Presented at the festival were more than 600 achievements made in scientific researches and technological innovations including cutting edge technical products, equipment and production processes based on latest science and technology.
					
					 Drawing keen interest of the participants were proposals for boosting the grain production and putting various economic sectors on a scientific and technological basis including breeding new species of rice, making an effective use of marine resources in the agricultural production, producing locally available food for cat fish, etc.
					
					 Present at the closing ceremony were Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Han Kwang Bok, department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and other officials concerned, scientists and technicians of relevant fields, members of the three-revolution teams and other working people.
					
					 Results were announced by the jury at the ceremony.
					
					 Special places went to five units including the Central Information and Communications Centre and the 618 Cement Factory and first places were conferred upon 21 units including College of Computer Science of Kim Il Sung University, Metal Engineering Faculty of Kim Chaek University of Technology and the Pyongyang Catfish Farm.

articles.title: DPRK Pays Big Efforts to Giving All People Education
articles.content:
DPRK Pays Big Efforts to Giving All People Education
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The system of giving all people education has made great progress in the DPRK. 
					 The DPRK government has made big efforts to developing education, while paying deep attention to making better conditions and creating environment favorable for education.
					
					 It started the universal 12-year compulsory education system this new school year with due courses for improving teachers' qualification.
					
					 In particular, educational aid institutions are playing a positive role, supplying schools with lots of modern educational equipment and materials.
					
					 The DPRK also has the study-while-working system for higher education.
					
					 All the educational systems are free so as to make big contributions to educating all the people to be well versed in science and technology.

articles.title: News Analyst on U.S. Tragedy over Nuclear Issue
articles.content:
News Analyst on U.S. Tragedy over Nuclear Issue
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The DPRK's successful 3rd underground nuclear test in February Juche 102 (2013) made the world public incline toward an opinion that it is impossible to expect the DPRK's nuclear dismantlement.
					 Voice of Russia contended that the world should learn how to exist with the DPRK's nukes.
					
					 But the United States has stubbornly denied this stark reality.
					
					 It had already suffered setbacks in the 20-odd-year-long nuclear showdown with the DPRK.
					
					 In the first half of the 1990's when the 1st round of showdown came up between the DPRK and the U.S., the latter could not but come out to the negotiating table, upset by the former's toughest counteraction.
					
					 At that time the DPRK gave a warning that the nuclear issue in the Korean Peninsula would get more complicated and serious, when it was dealt at random, like a rolling snowball.
					
					 After all, the nuclear issue, spawned by the U.S., became more unpredictably complicated due to the U.S. misinterpretation of the denuclearization of the peninsula and its tightened hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					 At the beginning of the 21st century, the U.S. attempted again to brand the DPRK as a "nuclear criminal", clamoring about its "uranium enrichment" and, accordingly, the latter made a resolute decision to secede from the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT).
					
					 The DPRK government's statement on its withdrawal from the NPT brought the world public into a big confusion. In this regard, Japan's Sankei Shimbun (Internet) said: the Korean Central Broadcasting contended that the DPRK's withdrawal from the NPT touched the U.S. on the raw, and quoted leader Kim Jong Il as saying that the U.S. should be well aware of the DPRK and it is a tragedy of the U.S. to have failed to get a good understanding of it still now.
					
					 In the long run, the anachronistic deeds of the U.S., which had escalated the nuclear blackmail against the DPRK, having no understanding of it and constitutionally denying its ideology and social system, resulted in the successful 3rd nuclear test on the part of the DPRK. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the DPRK advanced a new strategic line of simultaneously pushing forward the economic construction and the building of nuclear force on the basis of its deterrent, which drove the U.S. into an abyss of self-contradiction.
					
					 It has been proved that time and justice stand by the DPRK, not the U.S. pretending to be "the only superpower".
					
					 This being the hard fact, the U.S. still persists in the "theory of disallowing the DPRK's possession of nukes" while calling for "resolute counteraction" against "provocation and threat" from it to deceive the world public. It was well illustrated by Obama's recent junket to south Korea.
					
					 Nowadays, the U.S. and its followers are viciously slandering the DPRK while clamoring about its "possible fourth nuclear test".
					
					 In this regard, the Rodong Sinmun, an organ of the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee, stressed that the DPRK would never abandon its sovereign rights but decisively counter the hostile forces' challenge with its toughest stand.
					
					 And the DPRK, through the April 27 statement of a spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea, declared again that it was entirely just that it judged and determined it should counter the U.S., the sworn enemy, by force only, not words, and finally settle accounts with the enemy through an all-out nuclear showdown and that it would invariably go along the road chosen by itself.
					
					 The U.S. is advised to grasp the meaning of this declaration, though belatedly. The more hell-bent the U.S. gets on the anti-DPRK nuclear racket with its worn-out "strategic patience policy", the more piteous plight it will be driven into.
					
					 The DPRK, which regards sovereignty and dignity, justice and peace as lifeblood, will never tolerate any slight encroachment on them.
					
					 It is a tragedy of the U.S. that it has not yet got a good understanding of the DPRK.

articles.title: Ferry Sinking Is Product of Unpopular Rule: News Analyst
articles.content:
Ferry Sinking Is Product of Unpopular Rule: News Analyst
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Large ferry "Sewol" sank in waters off Jin Island, South Jolla Province of south Korea on April 16, claiming lives of hundreds of people, mostly students.
					 Large-scale accidents of various kinds that take place in south Korea in succession are an inevitable product of the unpopular rule of the Park Geun Hye regime.
					
					 A video showing the initial stage of rescue operation at the time of sinking was shown on April 28. According to it, the captain and 15 crewmen safely escaped from the sinking ferry, leaving the passengers on board.
					
					 This is just part of crimes reflecting the poor human rights situation in south Korea where those in lower echelon are just same as those in upper echelon in their attitude towards the security and human rights of the people.
					
					 Parents and families of those students spent hours of distress after the sinking of the ferry, beating their chests. But the minister of Maritime Transport and Fisheries appeared at the scene of the accident only five days since the accident.
					
					 The prime minister went to the island allegedly to put the situation under control but he only went to deluxe boarding and the ministers of Education and Security and Administration were only concerned for meeting their own purposes, while failing to find out how many were reported missing.
					
					 Moreover, the puppet group was keen on evading the responsibilities, far from putting the situation under control as early as possible only to spark off people's criticism.
					
					 When families of those who went missing and the bereaved families expressed dissatisfaction with the delayed response of the "government" to the accident, the security chief of Chongwadae made such an excuse that "the office for state security is in charge for security and defence, not a disaster control command."
					
					 Park evaded the responsibility for the case and blamed public officials, saying, "She and government have nothing to do with the recent tragedy".
					
					 It is by no means fortuitous that the public became critical of the regime, saying that "the president is a problem" and "the daughter of dictator failed to learn the way of taking responsibilities".
					
					 The puppet group also employed a sleight of hand to conceal the essence of the issue in order to divert elsewhere the distrust and anger of the public at home and abroad caused by the sinking of the ferry.
					
					 The coteries of "the Saenuri Party", however, have been keen on local election campaign, criticizing the people and defending Park. Some philistines, in the meantime, did not hesitate to do such bullying acts as branding civic and public organizations that supported families of victims who demanded the probe into the accident as "leftist forces" and "forces following the north".
					
					 The recent sinking case clearly proved the unpopular nature of the south Korean ruling forces that do not care for the human rights of the people.

articles.title: Acts of Violating Freedom of Press in S. Korea Slammed
articles.content:
Acts of Violating Freedom of Press in S. Korea Slammed
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean weekly paper Media Today on April 28 denounced the Broadcasting and Communication Committee and the Broadcasting and News Agency Examination Committee of south Korea for violating the freedom of press as regards the sinking of the ferry "Sewol."
					 According to the paper, the Broadcasting and Communication Committee formed a "team for handling the disaster" as regards the sinking of the ferry and worked hard to build up public opinion quite contrary to facts at the instruction of the puppet regime.
					
					 It said:  
					
					 The above-said two committees let their officials perform a 24-hour emergency duty in a bid to limit public suspicions about the sinking of the ferry.
					
					 As regards the facts, the citizens' solidarity for reforming the media said that what media reported about the disaster is quite different from the facts because the "government" obstructs media's activities and the said committees are covering up or downplaying the case.
					
					 This is little short of an act of ignoring the freedom of media and the people's rights and media are reporting just as they have been "dictated."

articles.title: S. Koreans Called upon to Turn Out in Struggle against Puppet Regime
articles.content:
S. Koreans Called upon to Turn Out in Struggle against Puppet Regime
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea released an appeal on April 28 calling for turning out in the struggle against the incompetent puppet government.
					 The appeal said the present "government" failed to find even a single person among those buried at sea although more than ten days have passed since the sinking of ferry "Sewol".
					
					 All others remain indifferent even though people wail over their beloved ones' deaths in south Korea where no one owns any responsibility for the security and life of the people, the appeal deplored.
					
					 The incompetent "government" left students dead as it is only keen on maintaining power, indifferent to the security and life of the people, the appeal said, noting that no one can be responsible for them in south Korea, which looks like a sinking boat.
					
					 The irresponsible bureaucratic group does not do anything but only gets frantic with propaganda in favor of the "government", the appeal said.
					
					 The policy of easing restrictions for money-making and capital's pursuit of profits were the reasons for the sinking of the ferry, it noted, querying how many more people will be driven to death under the rule of the authorities who do not care for the security and life of the people in order to meet the needs of the corrupt capital.
					
					 All the responsibilities rest with Park, it said, holding that she should not be allowed to stay in power any longer.
					
					 There are only two ways for the people: to die or rise up in actions against the corrupt rule, the appeal said, calling on all of them to hold candlelight and turn out in the action to build society where the popular masses have emerged as its master.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye Censured as Root Cause of Disasters of Nation
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye Censured as Root Cause of Disasters of Nation
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Not a few days have passed since Park Geun Hye took office in Chongwadae in south Korea.
					 Being fascinated by honey-coated "commitments" made by Park early in her office, many people pinned great hope on her. But as months and years passed by, their hope turned into disappointment, rapidly touching off grudge and anger.
					
					 A flurry of censure and denunciation is directed to Park as she has lost all qualities as "president", human being and woman, a clear indication of the people's mindset.
					
					 Park is like an "owner of grave keeper's cottage" as she turned the whole of south Korea into a cemetery.
					
					 On April 16 ferry "Sewol" sank in waters off Jin Island, South Jolla Province of south Korea. This was a hideous man-made disaster deliberately caused by Park.
					
					 After getting notified of the accident, she reluctantly made her appearance in the scene where the rescue operation was under way. There she simply said that "she felt sorry" and expressed sham consolations to the bereaved families, uttering "they should trust the government".
					
					 As confusion was made in the rescue operation and a deliberate default was manifested in it, the bereaved families burst into bitter lamentation and criticism and grievances of people of various circles mounted high, Park convened a meeting of chief secretaries of Chongwadae on April 21 at which she began evading responsibility, as if she had nothing to do with the accident. She grumbled "the captain of the ferry behaved like a murderer", far from taking an appropriate measure. 
					
					 Park only admonished her stooges and trumpeted about responsibility with a cool look without clearly expressing any proper consolations and apology even though many days have passed since the tragedy. This inhumane act bereft of common sense has touched off extreme hatred and resentment among the people.
					
					 The preceding rulers of south Korea admitted responsibilities and made formal apologies whether they liked it or not, when huge disastrous accidents occurred, as they were unable to swim against the people's mindset.
					
					 But it was only Park who did not hesitate to show such a thrice-cursed behavior of mocking the people and evading responsibility.
					
					 That is why the south Korean public is branding Park, the boss of Chongwadae, as the "owner of grave keeper's cottage".
					
					 Park is a master-hand at slandering fellow countrymen and a woman confrontation maniac.
					
					 Park's confrontational hysteria of hurting the dignity and social system of the DPRK has already gone beyond the tolerance limit.
					
					 As she is keen on escalating the confrontation of the social systems, she, far from accepting with sincerity the series of fair proposals made by the DPRK for the improvement and development of the north-south relations from the outset of the year, viciously challenged them, calling them a "camouflaged peace offensive for conducting overseas propaganda and for inciting conflicts among southerners".
					
					 Park is an adventurous being who always goes to the extremes and has considered her fellow countrymen in the north as a principal enemy and target of confrontation and war. She is no more than a mentally deranged who does not have normal thinking faculty and insight, and a confrontation maniac just like a rabid dog always keen on biting others.
					
					 What she let loose day and night is just malignant mud-slinging at the DPRK's nuclear deterrence for self-defence, which only triggered off public jeers and censure.
					
					 Park made waste water-like reckless remarks slandering the DPRK's line on simultaneously developing two fronts after inviting her American master reminiscent of a wicked black monkey to visit south Korea on April 25.
					
					 The people are unanimous in deploring the fact that there is no remedy for curing Park's mental disease as she has gone so mad with hurling mud at the nuclear deterrence of justice which the fellow countrymen in the north have had access to prevent the outside forces from imposing a nuclear disaster upon them.
					
					 Worse still, she is making a new ploy so called "human rights issue in the north" aimed at hurting and slandering the fellow compatriots. This is also part of her confrontational hysteria.
					
					 If things had gone properly, Park should have looked back upon the pitiful reality of south Korea where students are choosing suicide owing to the unrealistic education policy and unpopular policy of discriminating against youth and children.
					
					 Nevertheless, she, at her American master's prodding, is unhesitatingly resorting to such thrice-cursed move to set up an international "office for human rights in the north," not content with desperately pulling up the DPRK over its inviolable human rights.
					
					 She is no more than an old prostitute coquetting with outside forces.
					
					 What she has done, kowtowing to outside forces since she took office as "president," clearly proves that she is no more than a dirty political harlot and old prostitute without an equal as she is steeped in sycophancy and treachery.
					
					 It was none other than Park who drove all the fellow countrymen into the danger of a nuclear disaster by staging Max Thunder in the wake of Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military drills targeted at the compatriots in the north with huge nuclear war means of the U.S. involved.
					
					  She is adding to her thrice-cursed crimes by leaving to the tender mercy of the U.S. the "right to command the wartime operations," a symbol of national sovereignty.
					
					  It is not hard for anyone to guess that the farce of postponing the transfer of the above-said right agreed with Obama in secrecy is a revelation of her sinister intention to make a preemptive attack on the DPRK, relying on her American master.
					
					 All Koreans are spitting on her as she is resorting to whorish and disgusting political prostitution only after leaving her soul or chastity violated at such old age of over 60.
					
					 The mindset of south Koreans is growing angry.
					
					 The voice of the people is the voice of God.
					
					 It is impossible for her to check or escape the deep-rooted grudge of the people.
					
					 As long as Park is allowed to stay in power it is absolutely impossible to see the improvement and development of the inter-Korean relations and peace and reunification of the country and the south Korean society and all Koreans will suffer only disasters and misfortunes.
					
					 It is necessary to remove the root cause of disasters of the nation as early as possible.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days Celebrated Abroad
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Photo exhibitions took place in Mongolia and South Africa and a seminar in the DR Congo and seminars and film shows in Russia and Ethiopia during the period from April 4 to 22 to celebrate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung and the 82nd anniversary of the heroic Korean People's Army (KPA). 
					 On display at the venues of the events were photos documenting the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 The participants in the film shows watched Korean films including "Arms of Korea". 
					
					 The director of "Gobi" Company of Mongolia said:
					
					 Kim Il Sung is always alive in the hearts not only of the Korean people but also of the Mongolian people as great leader. 
					
					 We know well about the exploits Kim Il Sung performed for the development of the friendly relations between the two countries. 
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un, who is identical to Kim Il Sung, will turn the DPRK into a rich and powerful country in the near future. 
					
					 The chairman of DR Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association said:
					
					 Kim Il Sung worked a historic miracle of defeating the U.S. and Japanese imperialists in one generation. 
					
					 The KPA is now bringing about miracles and innovations in all fields of socialist construction, foiling the ever-more undisguised moves of the imperialists to stifle the DPRK under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The exploits the President and HE Kim Jong Il performed for building the revolutionary armed forces and bolstering them up will always shine along with the history of army building in the DPRK. 
					
					 The general manager of a company of Russia praised Kim Jong Un as the most prominent man and genius of military affairs in the present times.

articles.title: Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Marked Abroad
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Celebration events took place at DPRK missions abroad to mark the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung during the period from April 2 to 18. They included receptions, photo and book exhibitions and film shows held at the DPRK missions in Cuba, Vietnam, Iran, Malaysia, Myanmar, Austria, Romania, the Czech Republic, Senegal, Libya, Egypt, Ethiopia, the DR Congo, Brazil and Peru and the DPRK permanent mission in the UN Office in Geneva and International Organizations and the DPRK permanent mission in the UN.
					 Displayed on the front walls of the venues of the events were portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and full-length pictures of the President standing together with Kim Jong Il. Floral baskets and bouquets were seen before them. 
					
					 On display at the venues of the events were photos documenting the undying exploits of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un, famous works of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu and photos and books introducing Songun Korea. 
					
					 The participants in the film shows watched Korean films including "Kimilsungia" and "Pyongyang Today".
					
					 The permanent vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of Vietnam said that Kim Il Sung devoted his whole life to the country, nation and the socialist cause. 
					
					 The prime minister of the Yangon Regional government of Myanmar said that the future of the DPRK is rosy and the Korean people will surely build a thriving nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The deputy general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of DR Congo said that the revolutionary career of Kim Il Sung, who devoted his all to the prosperity of the country and happiness of its people, will shine long with the DPRK steadily developing under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Brazilian Politician Denounces U.S. False Propaganda against DPRK
articles.content:
Brazilian Politician Denounces U.S. False Propaganda against DPRK
Pyongyang, May 2 (KCNA) -- Rosanita Campos, vice-president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil, contributed an article  titled "U.S. mobilizing venal media for false propaganda against the DPRK" to the newspaper Hora do Povo on April 23. 
					 The article accused some conservative media of blindly citing U.S. misinformation about the DPRK without confirming whether it is true or not. 
					
					 The Western media are hell bent on false propaganda and smear campaign with the financial backing of the CIA, the article noted, and went on: 
					
					 Any visitor to the DPRK will soon come to know that every misinformation was deliberately cooked up by the paid trumpeters meeting the interests of the U.S. to hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK. 
					
					 Socialist Korea is a genuine country where the people decide everything and the state serves them. 
					
					 Arrogant imperialists try to prevent all people from knowing about how the DPRK defeated the Japanese imperialists, beat back the aggression launched by the U.S., which was boasting of being "the strongest in the world", and built a socialist power. 
					
					 When the U.S. and south Korean puppet group found their sabotage futile, they kick up a groundless "human rights" campaign against the DPRK. 
					
					 The CIA and its relevant institutions pay a lot of money to hack writers to spread lies about socialist Korea. 
					
					 The readers should clearly understand that the U.S. propaganda against the DPRK is fabrication.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion del presidente de Mongolia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion del presidente de Mongolia
Pyongyang, 2 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, recibio un mensaje de felicitacion que le remitiera el 22 de abril el Presidente de Mongolia, Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj.
					El mensaje senala como sigue:
					
					En relacion con que Vd. fue reelecto como Primer Presidente del CDN de la RPDC en el primer periodo de sesiones de la XIII Legislatura de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, extiendo mis sinceras felicitaciones a Su Excelencia y al pueblo coreano.
					
					Estoy satisfecho de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre Mongolia y la RPDC se ampliaran y se desarrollaran conforme a los intereses de ambos pueblos.
					
					Estoy contento por la posibilidad de seguir cooperando en el futuro tambien con Su Excelencia para ampliar las relaciones y la cooperacion de nuestros paises en todas las esferas y consolidar la paz y la estabilidad de la region del Nordeste Asiatico.
					
					Deseo a Su Excelencia buena salud y felicidad y al amistoso pueblo coreano prosperidad y desarrollo.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe felicitacion del presidente de Myanmar
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe felicitacion del presidente de Myanmar
Pyongyang, 2 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, recibio un mensaje de felicitacion que le dirigiera el 22 de abril el Presidente de Myanmar, Thein Sein.
					La misiva senala como sigue:
					
					En relacion con que Su Excelencia fue elegido como Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea segun la unanime voluntad y deseo de todo el ejercito y el pueblo del pais, le extiendo cordiales felicitaciones en nombre del pueblo de Myanmar y en el mio propio.
					
					Estoy convencido de que bajo su probada orientacion, la RPDC seguira desarrollandose y el pueblo lograra sin parar la prosperidad.
					
					En esta oportunidad, deseo de todo corazon la felicidad y exitos a Vd. y el progreso y prosperidad continuos al pueblo de la RPDC.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe felicitacion del presidente nepales
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe felicitacion del presidente nepales
Pyongyang, 2 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, recibio un mensaje de felicitacion que le remitiera el 29 de abril el Presidente de Nepal, Ram Baran Yadav.
					La misiva senala:
					
					Reciba Su Excelencia mis sinceras felicitaciones en esta oportunidad feliz de su reeleccion como Primer Presidente del CDN de la RPDC.
					
					Hago votos por la buena salud y felicidad de Su Excelencia y grandes exitos en su trabajo y por el incesante progreso y prosperidad del pueblo de la RPDC.
					
					Le manifiesto a Su Excelencia el testimonio de mi alta consideracion.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion del presidente argelino
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion del presidente argelino
Pyongyang, 2 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, recibio un mensaje de felicitacion que le enviara el 16 de abril el Presidente de la Republica Argelina Democratica y Popular, Abdelaziz Bouteflika.
					El mensaje va como sigue:
					
					En relacion con su reeleccion como Primer Presidente del CDN de la RPDC, tengo el placer de extenderle las mas sinceras felicitaciones en nombre del pueblo y gobierno argelinos y en el mio propio y desearle grandes exitos en el cumplimiento de su noble tarea.
					
					Aprovecho esta oportunidad para reafirmar mi voluntad de esforzarme junto con Vd. por fortalecer las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises conforme a los intereses de ambos pueblos.
					
					Felicitandole una vez mas a Su Excelencia Primer Presidente, le expreso el testimonio de mi mas alta consideracion.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe felicitaciones de personalidades de Rusia y China
articles.content:
Colorful Events Held at Remodeled Songdowon International Children's Camp
Pyongyang, 2 de mayo (ACNC) -- Con motivo del dia de natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el 82o aniversario de la fundacion del heroico Ejercito Popular de Corea, el presidente y el vicepresidente del Consejo de Veteranos de Guerra Coreana de Rusia  dirigieron un mensaje de felicitacion y regalo al Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					Por otra parte, el director general de la compania de diseno de decoracion arquitectonica de China dedico un presente al Mariscal por las mismas efemerides.
					
					El presidente del consejo ruso entrego el mensaje y regalo el 9 de abril al embajador coreano en Rusia mientras el director general chino traslado el obsequio el  25 de abril a un funcionario coreano que trabaja ahora en China.

articles.title: Acto por 30o aniversario de obra de Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Acto por 30o aniversario de obra de Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, 2 de mayo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 2 en esta capital el acto por el 30o aniversario de publicacion de la obra del Dirigente Kim Jong Il "Para fortalecer mas la labor de los sindicatos".
					El trabajo, publicado el 3 de mayo del 73 (1984) de la Era Juche, aclara perfectamente el caracter, la mision, el objetivo de lucha, las tareas y los principios de accion de los sindicatos y los demas problemas teorico-practicos presentados en la construccion y las actividades de los mismos en la epoca del Juche.
					
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes los funcionarios de los sindicatos y los otros interesados, etc.
					
					El presidente del Comite Central de la Federacion General de los Sindicatos de Corea, Hyon Sang Ju, estuvo cargo del informe de la ocasion.
					
					El dijo que gracias a la publicacion de la obra, se enriquecieron la autoctona idea y teoria sobre la construccion de los sindicatos y se preparo el jalon de viraje trascendental para desarrollar la labor del gremio conforme a la demanda de nueva etapa de la revolucion coreana, y prosiguio:
					
					Bajo la direccion y atencion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, la FGSC se fortalecio y se desarrollo como entidad de educacion ideologica muy fiel a la direccion del Partido y el lider.
					
					La idea del Dirigente sobre la construccion de los sindicatos y sus hazanas las continua y desarrolla hoy el Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					El Mariscal concede gran importancia a la posicion y el papel de la FGSC y presento las tareas y remedios que corresponden a ella.
					
					En acato al espiritu de la 8a Conferencia de Funcionarios Ideologicos del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, debemos profundizar continuamente la educacion en la idea Juche, la del Songun, las politicas del Partido y las tradiciones revolucionarias con el fin de preparar a los funcionarios de la FGSC y los gremiales como kimilsungistas y kimjongilistas con gran fidelidad al Partido y al lider y la firme conviccion revolucionaria y alta conciencia clasista.
					
					Todos deben unirse firmemente en torno al Mariscal Kim Jong Un y luchar con dinamismo por la victoria final de la construccion de Estado prospero socialista y la causa revolucionaria del Juche bajo la bandera del gran kimilsungismo-kimjongilismo.

articles.title: Park Geun-hye debe ser eliminada cuanto antes
articles.content:
Park Geun-hye debe ser eliminada cuanto antes
Pyongyang, 2 de mayo (ACNC) -- Ya paso bastante tiempo desde la toma de Park Geun-hye del sillon presidencial de Chongwadae.
					Al principio del mandato de Park, la gente se hacia ilusion atraida por las agradables "promesas electorales" de ella, pero ahora expresa desenganada gran odio e indignacion.
					
					La avalancha de criticas a la mandataria surcoreana, quien perdio totalmente el honor de la "presidenta", el ser humano y la mujer, es un reflejo de la opinion publica.
					
					Park es la "duena de la casa de celadora de sepulcros" que convierte todo el territorio surcoreano en un cementerio.
					
					El 16 de abril pasado, ocurrio en el mar frente a la isla Jin de la provincia de Jolla del Sur el hundimiento del barco de pasajeros "Sewol".
					
					Este incidente fue causado artificialmente por Park.
					
					Algun tiempo despues de informada del caso, ella aparecio a desganas en el lugar de accidente y se limito a decir a los familiares de victimas: "!Que lastima!" y "Confien en el gobierno".
					
					Cuando los familiares expresaban el descontento por el disturbio y la negligencia en las labores de rescate quejando: "Quieren que mis hijos fueran devorados por los peces", Park convoco el 21 de abril una reunion de los secretarios superiores de Chongwadae en que trato de eludir las responsabilidades, en vez de tomar medidas necesarias, diciendo asi: "el capitan del barco se porto como asesino".
					
					Llegan al climax la indignacion y la colera de los habitantes por la conducta inhumana y anormal de Park, quien no pidio disculpas como se debe y critica solo a sus inferiores imputandoles la responsabilidad.
					
					Impotentes de desoir la voz del pueblo, hasta los anteriores gobernantes surcoreanos reconocian en lugares publicos las responsabilidades pidiendo disculpas si ocurria algun desastre tragico.
					
					La opinion publica califico oficialmente a Park de la "duena de la casa de celadora de sepulcros" comparando el tejado azul de Chongwadae con el tumulo.
					
					Park es gran maestro de demagogia y enfrentamiento.
					
					Ya paso el limite la fiebre conflictiva de Park que difama la dignidad y el regimen de la RPDC.
					
					Enloquecida por la confrontacion entre los regimenes de ambas partes coreanas, ella critico los imparciales proyectos, presentados desde principios de este ano por la RPDC para la mejora y el desarrollo de las relaciones intercoreanas, como "ofensiva de paz disfrazada", "para la propaganda al exterior" y "para provocar las discrepancias entre personas".
					
					Ella no pasa de ser una discapacitada mental que no puede pensar y ver normalmente y se dedica solo al enfrentamiento como perra rabiosa.
					
					La incesante difamacion de Park sobre el disuasivo nuclear autodefensivo de la RPDC esta causando la burla y criticas de la opinion publica.
					
					Pero, ella invito el 25 de abril a su amo gringo, parecido a un mono negro malo, y volvio a calumniar la linea de la RPDC de impulsar simultaneamente la construccion economica y la de fuerzas armadas nucleares.
					
					La opinion publica lamenta unanimemente que no hay en el presente ni habra en el futuro la medicina que pueda curar la histeria de Park quien difama obstinadamente el justo disuasivo nuclear poseido por los connacionales a fin de prevenir el desastre nuclear que quieren imponer las fuerzas extranjeras.
					
					El llamado problema de "DDHH del Norte", que suele mencionar Park, tambien parte de la locura conflictiva de ella.
					
					Para ser correcto, Park tendria que atender primero la realidad espantosa del Sur de Corea donde cada dia se suicidan muchos jovenes  debido a la politica de ensenanza irrealista y la de discriminacion de la juventud y la infancia.
					
					Sin embargo, a la instigacion de su amo norteamericano, la mandataria surcoreana esta enfrascada en cuestionar los sagrados DDHH de la RPDC y no vacila en instalar hasta la "oficina de DDHH del Norte" de nivel internacional.
					
					Park es una ramera vieja que coquetea a las fuerzas extranjeras.
					
					Desde que tomara el poder, Park cometio acciones serviles a las fuerzas extranjeras demostrando su atributo de prostituta politica.
					
					Es Park Geun-hye la autora quien empuja a todos los coreanos al crisol de desastre nuclear al realizar los ejercicios militares conjuntos "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle" y hasta el simulacro aereo combinado "Max Thunder".
					
					Park trata de encomendar para siempre a EE.UU. hasta el "mando de operaciones en el tiempo de guerra", simbolo de la soberania.
					
					Ultimamente, Park prometio en secreto a Obama la dilacion del traspaso del "mando de operaciones en el tiempo de guerra", lo cual parte de su intencion de dar el ataque preventivo contra la RPDC con la ayuda de su amo gringo.
					
					Todos los coreanos escupen en esa ramera politiquera que a pesar de mas de 60 anos de su edad, vive con la prostitucion politica sin espiritu nacional ni entereza.
					
					La opinion publica surcoreana vibra de odio.
					
					La opinion publica es la voz del cielo.
					
					El clamor del pueblo llega al cielo.
					
					Si se deja intacta a Park, no se puede alcanzar la mejora ni desarrollo de las relaciones intercoreanas, ni la paz ni la reunificacion del pais. Al contrario, provendran las calamidades y desgracias para la sociedad surcoreana y toda la nacion coreana.
					
					Hay que eliminar cuanto antes a Park Geun-hye, causa de desastres.

articles.title: Hundimiento del barco "Sewol" es producto de politica antipopular de autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
Hundimiento del barco "Sewol" es producto de politica antipopular de autoridades surcoreanas
Pyongyang, 2 de mayo (ACNC) -- El 16 de abril pasado, ocurrio en el mar frente a la isla Jin de la provincia de Jolla del Sur de Corea el hundimiento del barco de pasajeros "Sewol" que dejo centenares de muertos, inclusive los alumnos.
					Es otro producto inevitable de la politica antipopular del "poder" de Park Geun-hye.
					
					Segun el video publicado el 28 de abril, todos los 15 tripulantes, inclusive el capitan, se escaparon del barco hundido abandonando a los pasajeros.
					
					Se puede saber que ellos tienen la misma actitud de las autoridades sobre la vida, la seguridad y los derechos humanos del pueblo.
					
					Viendo el barco hundiendo con alumnos pequenos a bordo, sus padres esperaban angustiados la noticia de sus queridos hijos, pero, el ministro de Transporte Maritimo y Pesca aparecio en el lugar de accidente a los 5 dias.
					
					El "primer ministro", que acudio a la isla Jin con el pretexto de remediar la situacion, estuvo en busca de alojamientos superlujosos. En tanto, los ministros de Educacion y de Seguridad y Administracion se dieron a la tarea de atender los asuntos privados sin averiguar siquiera el numero de desaparecidos.
					
					La banda titere surcoreana trato de eludir las responsabilidades, en vez de remediar lo mas pronto posible la situacion, lo cual deparo fuertes criticas del pueblo.
					
					Cuando los familiares de desaparecidos y difuntos expresaron descontento sobre la reaccion tardia del "gobierno", el "jefe de seguridad" de Chongwadae respondio que "la oficina de seguridad estatal se encarga de la seguridad y la defensa nacional y no es la torre de control para el desastre natural y otros".
					
					La mandataria imputo a los oficiales publicos las responsabilidades del caso diciendo que "ella y el gobierno no tienen nada que ver con la tragedia".
					
					La opinion publica transmite que "la presidenta tiene problema" y "la hija del dictador no aprendio asumir las responsabilidades".
					
					Aun en tales condiciones, la banda del "Partido Saenuri" anda enfrascada en la campana de elecciones locales, criticando a los habitantes y amparando a la mandataria. Por otra parte, unos politiqueros definen como "fuerzas izquierdistas" y "pro-Norte" a los familiares de victimas, que exigen la averiguacion del caso, y las entidades civiles y sociales que lo apoyan.
					
					El hundimiento del barco demuestra claramente la naturaleza anti-popular de las autoridades surcoreanas que no piensan ni en el sueno en los DDHH del pueblo.
